name: Christian Mythology
tagline: The Gospel of Salvation and Divine Grace
description: Explore Christian sacred narratives of creation, fall, redemption through Christ, and the promised Kingdom of God.
overview: Christian mythology centers on Jesus Christ as the incarnate Son of God who died for humanity's sins and rose from the dead, offering salvation and eternal life. The tradition encompasses: God as Trinity (Father, Son, Holy Spirit), creation and fall of humanity, covenant history with Israel, Christ's incarnation and resurrection, the Church as Christ's body, angelic hierarchies, Satan and fallen angels, the Second Coming and Last Judgment, and the New Heaven and New Earth. Christianity inherited Jewish scriptures (Old Testament) while adding new revelation (New Testament). Major branches include Catholic, Orthodox, and Protestant traditions, each with distinct theological emphases and practices. The mythology incorporates mystical traditions (Gnosticism, Christian Kabbalah, hesychasm), saints and martyrs, apocalyptic literature, and sacramental theology.

culturalContext.primarySources: Bible (Old & New Testament), Church Fathers, Apocrypha, Gnostic texts

sections.title: The Holy Trinity
sections.body:
One God in three persons:

**God the Father:** Creator, sovereign over all, loving parent
**God the Son (Jesus Christ):** Eternally begotten, incarnate as human, savior through death and resurrection
**God the Holy Spirit:** Proceeds from Father (and Son in Western tradition), sanctifier, giver of spiritual gifts

Three distinct persons, one divine essence (homoousios). Central mystery of Christian faith.

sections.title: Creation, Fall, & Redemption
sections.body:
**Creation:** God creates good world in six days, humanity in divine image
**Fall:** Adam and Eve disobey, bringing sin and death into world
**Covenant:** God works through Israel, law, prophets to prepare redemption
**Incarnation:** Word (Logos) becomes flesh in Jesus Christ
**Crucifixion:** Christ dies as sacrifice for sin, defeats death
**Resurrection:** Christ rises, conquers death, offers eternal life
**Church Age:** Holy Spirit empowers believers to spread Gospel
**Second Coming:** Christ returns to judge, establish Kingdom
**New Creation:** Heaven and earth renewed, God dwells with humanity forever

sections.title: Core Teachings of Jesus
sections.body:
**Kingdom of God:** Already present yet still coming - spiritual reality breaking into world
**Love:** Love God completely, love neighbor as self (includes enemies)
**Grace:** Salvation by God's unmerited favor, not human works
**Sermon on the Mount:** Beatitudes, Lord's Prayer, ethics of Kingdom
**Parables:** Stories revealing Kingdom truths (Prodigal Son, Good Samaritan, etc.)
**Universal Salvation:** God desires all to be saved (1 Tim 2:4), Christ draws all to himself (John 12:32)
